snippet: Senator Rand Paul broke with fellow Republicans by saying that the focus on stricter voting laws to crack down on fraud alienates African-Americans and hurts the party.
abstract: Kentucky Sen Rand Paul, breaking with fellow Republicans who have pushed for stricter voting laws, says focus alienates and insults African-Americans and hurts the party; he becomes most prominent member of his party to distance himself from campaigns for voting restrictions, many of which are being pursued in states that can determine presidential elections.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin contributed reporting from Memphis, and Nick Corasaniti from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Senator Rand Paul broke with fellow Republicans by saying that the focus on stricter voting laws to crack down on fraud alienates African-Americans and hurts the party.

headline.main: Paul Diverges From His Party Over Voter ID
headline.print_headline: Paul Diverges From His Party Over Voter ID
